net.sf.mmm.util.resource.api

Class ResourcePathNode<D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.resource.api.ResourcePathNode<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - is the type of the generic data. For simple usage just Void.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, ResourcePath
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootAbsolute, ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootHome, ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootRelative, ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootUnc, ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootUrl, ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootWindows

    public class ResourcePathNode<D>
extends Object
implements ResourcePath, Serializable
    This class represents a path in a file, URL, or the like.
    Since:
    7.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootAbsolute<D>
      Implementation of Unix/Linux absolute root.
      static class  ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootHome<D>
      Implementation of home absolute root (~ or ~login).
      static class  ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootRelative<D>
      Implementation of relative root.
      static class  ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootUnc<D>
      Implementation of UNC absolute root.
      static class  ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootUrl<D>
      Implementation of Unix/Linux absolute root.
      static class  ResourcePathNode.ResourcePathRootWindows<D>
      Implementation of Windows absolute root drive.

        Specified by:

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if this path matches the given the given patternPath.

      • navigateTo

        public ResourcePathNode<D> navigateTo(ResourcePathNode<D> path)
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to navigate to from this path.
        Returns:
        the given path if absolute, otherwise the normalized path of this path with the given path appended.

      • navigateUp

        private ResourcePathNode<D> navigateUp()
        Returns:
        this instance if this is the root or is ResourcePath.PATH_SEGMENT_PARENT_DIRECTORY, the parent otherwise.

      • navigateFrom

        Recursive and inverted implementation of navigateTo(ResourcePathNode).
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - is the ResourcePathNode to navigate from.
        Returns:
        the resulting ResourcePathNode.

      • create

        public static ResourcePathNode<Void> create(String path)
        Creates a normalized ResourcePathNode. Here are some examples:
        path ResourcePathNode.create(path)
          toString() isAbsolute() getName()
        "/foo//bar/" "/foo/bar" true "bar"
        "/foo/bar" "/foo/bar" true "bar"
        "a/../b/./c" "b/c" false "c"
        "a/../../" ".." false ".."
        "a/.." "" false ""
        "../a" "../a" false "a"
        "/../a" "/a" true "a"
        "~/.ssh" "~/.ssh" true ".ssh"
        "~admin/../" "~admin/.." true ".."
        "/" "" true "/"
        "" "" false ""
        null - (null) - (null) - (null)
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to parse (e.g. "/foo/bar.txt" or "a/../b/./c").
        Returns:
        the parsed path as ResourcePathNode or null if empty.

      • createPattern

        public static ResourcePathNode<Pattern> createPattern(String path)
        Calls create(String, Function) with data function delegating to WildcardGlobPatternCompiler.
        Parameters:
        path - - see create(String).
        Returns:
        the parsed ResourcePathNode.
        See Also:
        create(String), matches(ResourcePathNode)

      • create

        public static <D> ResourcePathNode<D> create(String path,
                                             Function<ResourcePathNode<D>,D> dataFunction)
        Flexible implementation of create(String) to custom data function.
        Type Parameters:
        D - is the type of the generic data. For simple usage just Void.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to parse.
        dataFunction - - the Function to create the data.
        Returns:
        the parsed path.

      • createRootPathSegment

        private static <D> ResourcePathNode<D> createRootPathSegment(CharSequenceScanner scanner,
                                                             String originalPath,
                                                             Function<ResourcePathNode<D>,D> dataFunction)
        Type Parameters:
        D - is the type of the generic data. For simple usage just Void.
        Parameters:
        scanner - the fresh CharSequenceScanner for the entire path (normalized from of originalPath). Only the root segment shall be consumed.
        originalPath - is the original path without normalization of slashed (may contain backslashes).
        dataFunction - - the Function to create the data.
        Returns:
        the root path segment.
        See Also:
        create(String), isRoot()
